CURRENT_TIMER.name: timer [x]
argumentsRequiredInfo: `3d20h30m`, with your own numbers, or a single integer for hours (`0` to pause). If you add a + sign in front of the new timer, the amount will get added to the timer, instead of replaced.
CURRENT_TIMER.helpText: Used to either check (when used without arguments) or change the timer of the current turn. Can take a combination of days/hours/minutes, or a single number for hours. Can only be used by the organizer or higher permissions.

DEFAULT_TIMER.name: dtimer [x]
argumentsRequiredInfo: `3d20h30m`, with your own numbers, or a single integer for hours (`0` to pause). If you add a + sign in front of the new timer, the amount will get added to the timer, instead of replaced.
DEFAULT_TIMER.helpText: Used to either check (when used without arguments) or change the global timer of the game. Can take a combination of days/hours/minutes, or a single number for hours. Can only be used by the organizer or higher permissions.

CHANGE_PLAYER_PREFERENCES.name: preferences
CHANGE_PLAYER_PREFERENCES.helpText: Displays the preferences menu of the game hosted in this channel by sending you a PM (Private Message), or your global preferences if in another channel. In that menu you will find options to set turn reminders and automated turn backups.

CHANGE_SETTINGS.name: settings
CHANGE_SETTINGS.helpText: Allows the organizer of a game to change its settings if the game hasn't started yet.

CLAIM_PRETENDER.name: claim
argumentsRequiredInfo: A number that matches the pretender's index displayed
CLAIM_PRETENDER.helpText: Claims a submitted pretender as yours for this game, which will give you access to advanced features like getting turn backups or turn reminders.

DEBUG_GAME.name: debug
argumentsRequiredInfo: A game's name

DELETE_GAME.name: deletegamenotchannel
DELETE_GAME.helpText: Permanently deletes the game hosted in this channel, while leaving the channel intact.

DELETE_GAME_AND_CHANNEL.name: deletegameandchannel
DELETE_GAME_AND_CHANNEL.helpText: Permanently deletes the game hosted in this channel, as well as the channel itself.

DELETE_GAME_BY_DM.name: deletegamebydm
argumentsRequiredInfo: A game's name
DELETE_GAME_BY_DM.helpText: Permanently deletes the game and its channel and role.

DELETE_UNUSED_MAPS.name: deleteunusedmaps
argumentsRequiredInfo: `force` to actually delete the files
DELETE_UNUSED_MAPS.helpText: Deletes all the maps on a target server which are currently not used by any ongoing game.

DELETE_UNUSED_MODS.name: deleteunusedmods
argumentsRequiredInfo: `force` to actually delete the files
DELETE_UNUSED_MODS.helpText: Deletes all the mods on a target server which are currently not used by any ongoing game.

DEPLOY_BOT.name: deploy
DEPLOY_BOT.helpText: Only useable by the guild's owner. This is the first command that must be used after the bot is added to a guild, so that it can deploy the necessary categories and roles. It can be used again to re-create missing categories and roles.

DISPLAY_SUBMITTED_PRETENDERS.name: pretenders
DISPLAY_SUBMITTED_PRETENDERS.helpText: Displays a list of submitted pretenders in the game hosted in the channel. You can then claim a pretender, unclaim it, remove it or designate a substitute for it.

FORCE_HOST.name: forcehost
FORCE_HOST.helpText: Forces a turn to roll immediately.

GET_CURRENT_TURN_FILE.name: turnfile
GET_CURRENT_TURN_FILE.helpText: Requests the claimed nation's current turn file.

GET_MAPS_ON_SERVER.name: maps
argumentsRequiredInfo: `Either 'dom5' or 'dom6'`
GET_MAPS_ON_SERVER.helpText: Prints a list of the Dominions maps available on the servers.

GET_MODS_ON_SERVER.name: mods
argumentsRequiredInfo: `Either 'dom5' or 'dom6'`
GET_MODS_ON_SERVER.helpText: Prints a list of the Dominions mods available on the servers.

GET_NATIONS.name: nations
argumentsRequiredInfo: `Either 'dom5' or 'dom6'`
GET_NATIONS.helpText: Prints a list of all the Dominions 5 or 6's nations and their numbers and filenames.

GET_SCORES.name: scores
GET_SCORES.helpText: Requests the current turn's scores file. Only available for games with visible scoregraphs, or games which have ended.

GET_GAME_INFO.name: info
GET_GAME_INFO.helpText: Prints this game's information and settings.

GET_GAMES_BY_LAST_HOSTED.name: lasthosted
GET_GAMES_BY_LAST_HOSTED.helpText: Prints a list of all hosted games in this Discord guild, or all games if the command is sent by DM, sorted by the last time they had a turn.

GET_LIST_OF_HOSTED_GAMES.name: games
GET_LIST_OF_HOSTED_GAMES.helpText: Prints a list of all hosted games in this Discord guild, or all games if the command is sent by DM.

GET_LIST_OF_PROCESSING_TURNS.name: processing
GET_LIST_OF_PROCESSING_TURNS.helpText: Prints currently processing turns, ordered by the time at which they started doing so.

GET_LIST_OF_UNDONE_TURNS.name: undone
GET_LIST_OF_UNDONE_TURNS.helpText: Prints a list nations whose turns' are undone or unfinished.

GET_LIST_OF_FREE_HOSTING_SLOTS.name: capacity
GET_LIST_OF_FREE_HOSTING_SLOTS.helpText: Prints the list of servers with the number of free hosting slots in each.

GET_MASTER_PASSWORD.name: password
GET_MASTER_PASSWORD.helpText: [Organizer-only] Sends the game's master password by DM.

GET_PATREON_LINK.name: patreon
GET_PATREON_LINK.helpText: Prints a link to the Patreon for those who wish to support the project. Thank you!

GET_SETTING_VALUE_ACROSS_GAMES.name: values
argumentsRequiredInfo: `A setting key`
GET_SETTING_VALUE_ACROSS_GAMES.helpText: [Dev Only] Receive a list of the values of a setting currently in use in every Dominions game.

HELP.name: help
HELP.helpText: Get a FAQ on the functionality of the bot.

HOST_GAME.name: host
argumentsRequiredInfo: The name of the server to host the game on; use `!capacity` to see the available ones
The type of game to host; either 'dom5' or 'dom6'
HOST_GAME.helpText: Starts the process to host a Dominions 5 or 6 game. You will be asked a series of settings by DM to configure it.

HOST_GAME_WEB.name: host_web
HOST_GAME_WEB.helpText: Starts the process to host a Dominions 5 or 6 game using the website interface. You will be able to configure it through an HTML form.

KILL_GAME_PROCESS.name: kill
KILL_GAME_PROCESS.helpText: Shuts down a game's process. Useful to relaunch it to fix common errors. Does not delete anything.

PAUSE_GAME.name: pause
PAUSE_GAME.helpText: Pauses or unpauses a game's timer.

PIN_SETTINGS.name: pinsettings
PIN_SETTINGS.helpText: Sends and pins the current game settings to the channel.

POST_NEWS.name: post
POST_NEWS.helpText: [Dev Only] Posts a message across all clockwork_news channels in all the Discord guilds where the bot is present.

PRUNE_DATA.name: prunedata
PRUNE_DATA.helpText: [Dev Only] Prunes obsolete player data, like leftover game data or preferences from games that do not exist anymore.

REMOVE_PRETENDER.name: remove
argumentsRequiredInfo: A number that matches the pretender's index displayed
REMOVE_PRETENDER.helpText: Removes a submitted pretender for this game.

REPLACE_BOT_ROLE.name: replace
argumentsRequiredInfo: The bot's role name or id to be replaced
The new role's name or id
REPLACE_BOT_ROLE.helpText: Replaces one of the basic bot roles created for this Discord guild by a different existing role. Useful if the guild already has a trusted role for members and doesn't want to use the bot's Trusted role, for example.

RESET_PORT.name: resetport
RESET_PORT.helpText: Assigns a new port to the game (or the same one if it's found to be free).

RESTABLISH_GAME.name: restablish
argumentsRequiredInfo: A game's name
RESTABLISH_GAME.helpText: Restablishes a game's deleted channel and/or role.

RESTART_GAME.name: restartandgobacktolobby
argumentsRequiredInfo: `True` if you want the previously submitted pretenders to be deleted
RESTART_GAME.helpText: Restarts a game and goes back to turn 0, in the pretender submission lobby, where every player will have to resubmit their pretenders.

ROLL_DICE.name: [x]d[y]
ROLL_DICE.helpText: Rolls dice. Several dice can be chained together, i.e. `5d6+10d10`. Adding a `+` after a dice expression will make them explosive, i.e. `5d6++10d10+`.

ROLLBACK_TURN.name: rollback
ROLLBACK_TURN.helpText: Rollbacks the game to the previous turn. This cannot be undone. Only a couple rollbacks are available at a time, depending on the server's size.

SET_LOG_LEVEL.name: setloglevel
argumentsRequiredInfo: The numerical level of logging verbosity, inclusive from 0 (lean) to 2 (verbose)
SET_LOG_LEVEL.helpText: [Dev Only] Sets the verbosity level of the logging functions to the console and files, with values ranging from 0 (lean) to 2 (verbose).

SET_ORGANIZER.name: setorganizer
argumentsRequiredInfo: `A mention to the new organizer (@Username#0000)`
SET_ORGANIZER.helpText: Sets a member as the organizer of this game. If an organizer exists; replaces them.

SHUFFLE.name: shuffle
argumentsRequiredInfo: `A space-separated list of things, i.e mentions or numbers
SHUFFLE.helpText: Shuffles a list of space-separated elements, i.e. mentions to members to create a draft order, or just words or numbers.

START_GAME.name: start
START_GAME.helpText: Starts the game with the submitted pretenders. Generating the map and/or starts may take from a few minutes to 20 or more, depending on the size of the game and the server.

SUBSCRIBE_TO_GAME.name: subscribe
SUBSCRIBE_TO_GAME.helpText: Assigns you the role of a game so you can be pinged when new turns or timer changes occur. Claiming a pretender assigns it automatically.

SUBSTITUTE_PLAYER.name: sub
argumentsRequiredInfo: A number that matches the pretender's index displayed
A mention to the player who will be taking over
SUBSTITUTE_PLAYER.helpText: Transfers the claim on a pretender to another player.

SWITCH_TIMER_ENFORCER.name: switchtimerenforcer
SWITCH_TIMER_ENFORCER.helpText: Switches from bot-enforced timer to game-enforced timer, and vice versa. The former means the bot will control the game timer and force host the game when the timer reaches zero. In this mode, the in-game Dominions timer won't be visible, but it should be more robust and reliable. The latter delegates the timer to Dominions and simply reads the current timer information off of the game's output, thus showing an ingame timer as well.

TOGGLE_CLEANER.name: togglecleaner
TOGGLE_CLEANER.helpText: [Dev Only] Sets whether the bot will regularly clean unused map and mod files.

TOGGLE_LOG_TO_FILE.name: togglelogtofile
TOGGLE_LOG_TO_FILE.helpText: [Dev Only] Sets whether the bot will log its prints to files.

UNCLAIM_PRETENDER.name: unclaim
argumentsRequiredInfo: A number that matches the pretender's index displayed
UNCLAIM_PRETENDER.helpText: Removes your claim from your submitted pretender.

UNDEPLOY_BOT.name: undeploy
UNDEPLOY_BOT.helpText: Only useable by the guild's owner. This will attempt to delete all categories, channels and roles that the bot created on deployment.

UNSUBSCRIBE_FROM_GAME.name: unsubscribe
UNSUBSCRIBE_FROM_GAME.helpText: Removes the role of a game from you. Unclaiming/removing your pretender does so automatically.

UPDATE_HELP_CHANNELS.name: updatehelp
argumentsRequiredInfo: A guild ID, if only one channel requires updating.
UPDATE_HELP_CHANNELS.helpText: [Dev Only] Re-writes the help information on the guild's help channel, to update it to the latest changes (i.e. new commands, changes in wordings, etc.).

UPLOAD_FILE_TO_SERVER.name: upload
argumentsRequiredInfo: `Either 'dom5' or 'dom6'`
a google drive file ID or link
UPLOAD_FILE_TO_SERVER.helpText: Allows you to upload a dom5 or dom6 map/mod to the server through google drive. To use it, first specify the game type (`dom5` or `dom6`), and then add the google drive file sharing link at the end of the command (which can be found when you right click a file on the drive website and click on Get Shareable Link). The package must be a .zip file containing the mod or map as is meant to be extracted into the mods or maps folder. If files with the same name exist in the server, they will not be overwritten.
